overview: Amritsar, in Punjab, is the holiest city for Sikhs and home to the Golden Temple (Harmandir Sahib). It is a major pilgrimage and tourism centre, known for its historic sites such as Jallianwala Bagh and the daily flag‑lowering ceremony at the Wagah border.
travelTips: Use trains (e.g., Shatabdi Express) or buses from Delhi for affordable access.
Local bus from Wagah to Amritsar costs ₹40; rickshaw from the border is ₹20 for 3 km.
Taxis and rickshaws within the city charge ₹200‑₹500 for longer trips; negotiate fares.
Visit the Golden Temple early morning to avoid crowds and enjoy the community kitchen.
Carry cash in INR for small transport fares and entry fees; most attractions are free or low cost.
